summary: Directly smelt ore into ingots using Alteration Magic
descriptionHtml:
Allows a magic user to directly smelt raw ore into ingots.
Each ore type has it\'s own spell so you can smelt exactly what you want.
While based on the transmute spell for concept, I found that one rather limited 
in the fact that it was not a concentration spell, forcing me to repeatedly
cast the spell over and over to transmute large amounts of ore.

I looked at several transmutation mods, but wasn\'t able to find any
that were concentration spells, so I decided to make one.

All spells are concentration spells, meaning, ore is converted for as long
as you have magicka (and ore!) and hold the casting buttons.  This can
be rather expensive on the magicka side, so it is best to have enchanted
items that reduce the cost of Alteration spells.

The books for these can all be purchased from the Riverwood trader.
Note: should be compatible with most mods, even if they modify the Riverwood trader inventory (these books were added with a script)

========================
Release History:
========================

   * 1.1 - Fixed a looping problem.  
             Apparantly, the game engine won\'t always fire an OnEffectEnd 
             event when the player stops casting.  The fix means the sound
             and message only play 1 time, though the player can continue
             to cast the spell and use Magica, gaining experience, without
             having to produce ingots.
   * 1.0 - First Release
           Contains smelting for:
             Iron, Corundum, Silver, 
             Quicksilver, Moonstone, Gold, 
             Malachite, Orichalcum, and Ebony.
           Each spell will create one ingot for two ore.
           Dual casting the spell will create two ingots for two ore
           Levels: Alteration
                Apprentice (25)    Iron, Corundum, Silver
                Adept      (50)    Quicksilver, Moonstone, Gold
                Expert     (75)    Malachite, Orichalcum, Ebony

Highly recommend using with this mod: 	[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10690]Mining Flames[/url]
